definition: triad, Chinese crime gang/triad society, anti-Manchu secret society in Qing-dynasty China
surname San
three/3
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
variant of 合[he2]
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Mr. Tao also invited the triads to set up businesses in China.
sentences.chinese: 陶驷驹还邀请三合会到大陆投资设厂。

sentences.english: Throughout the year, the fight against triads and organised criminal syndicates continued.
sentences.chinese: 年内，警方继续打击三合会及有组织犯罪集团。

sentences.english: They have their cosa nostra, we have our triads.
sentences.chinese: 他们有黑手党，我们有三合会。

sentences.english: Investigates complex organised crime and serious triad offences.
sentences.chinese: 调查复杂的有组织罪案和严重的三合会罪行。

definition: see 天地會|天地会[Tian1 di4 hui4]

late-Qing underground resistance movement against the Qing dynasty
